page.title: 19Forestry
page.content: About 30% of our area is covered by trees mainly{Scots Pine.}They add a great deal to the beautiful scenery but they are not grown for that purpose. They are a{crop to}be sold to sawmills or pulpmills after 15-30 year's growth. The timber is then used for building purposes, palets, boat-building,railway sleepers or furniture. Pulp is used to make paper. A forester's work involves collecting and extracting the seeds, preparing nursery beds where the seed is sown, then weeding. The seedlings are then transferred to lines where they grow for 1-2 years. They are then ready to be planted out in the woods. Roughly{40-50 acres}are planted every year with Scots Pine on dry sites,{Norway Spruce}and{Sitka}on wet sites and{Lodgepole Pine}on poorest soils.
